PARAGRAPH.STRING: (Михаи́л Серге́евич Горбачёв, Mihail Sergeevič Gorbačëv, [IPA: mʲɪxʌˈil sʲɪrˈgʲejɪvʲɪʨ gərbʌˈʨof], commonly written as Mikhail Gorbachev; born March 2 1931) was leader of the Soviet Union from 1985 until 1991.
attempts at reform helped to end the Cold War, and also ended the political supremacy of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union (CPSU) and dissolved the Soviet Union.
was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1990.
